ability: possession of the qualities (especially mental qualities) required to do something or get something done
abroad: far away from home or one's usual surroundings
accident: anything that happens suddenly or by chance without an apparent cause
account: an itemized statement of money owed for goods shipped or services rendered
act: pretend to have certain qualities or state of mind
active: engaged in or ready for military or naval operations
activity: an organic process that takes place in the body
actor: a person who acts and gets things done
ad: in the Christian era; used before dates after the supposed year Christ was born
addition: something added to what you already have
administration: the persons (or committees or departments etc.) who make up a body for the purpose of administering something
advance: move forward, also in the metaphorical sense
advantage: benefit resulting from some event or action
advertising: the business of drawing public attention to goods and services
advice: a proposal for an appropriate course of action
affair: a usually secretive or illicit sexual relationship
afternoon: a conventional expression of greeting or farewell
age: a time of life (usually defined in years) at which some particular qualification or power arises
agency: the state of serving as an official and authorized delegate or agent
agent: the semantic role of the animate entity that instigates or causes the happening denoted by the verb in the clause
agreement: the statement (oral or written) of an exchange of promises
airline: a hose that carries air under pressure
airport: an airfield equipped with control tower and hangars as well as accommodations for passengers and cargo
alarm: fear resulting from the awareness of danger
alcohol: a liquor or brew containing alcohol as the active agent
alternative: serving or used in place of another
amount: how much there is or how many there are of something that you can quantify
analysis: a set of techniques for exploring underlying motives and a method of treating various mental disorders; based on the theories of Sigmund Freud
angle: a biased way of looking at or presenting something
animal: marked by the appetites and passions of the body
annual: a reference book that is published regularly once every year
anxiety: (psychiatry) a relatively permanent state of worry and nervousness occurring in a variety of mental disorders, usually accompanied by compulsive behavior or attacks of panic
anybody: Any one out of an indefinite number of persons; anyone; any person.
anywhere: at or in or to any place
apartment: a suite of rooms usually on one floor of an apartment house
appeal: attractiveness that interests or pleases or stimulates
appearance: pretending that something is the case in order to make a good impression
apple: native Eurasian tree widely cultivated in many varieties for its firm rounded edible fruits
application: liquid preparation having a soothing or antiseptic or medicinal action when applied to the skin
appointment: the act of putting a person into a non-elective position
area: a part of an animal that has a special function or is supplied by a given artery or nerve
argument: a course of reasoning aimed at demonstrating a truth or falsehood; the methodical process of logical reasoning
arm: any instrument or instrumentality used in fighting or hunting
army: the army of the United States of America; the agency that organizes and trains soldiers for land warfare
art: the products of human creativity; works of art collectively
article: a separate section of a legal document (as a statute or contract or will)
aside: out of the way (especially away from one's thoughts)
aspect: the feelings expressed on a person's face
assignment: a duty that you are assigned to perform (especially in the armed forces)
assist: work for or be a servant to
assistance: a person or thing that is a resource that helps make something easier or possible to do
assistant: a person who contributes to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort or purpose
associate: make a logical or causal connection
assumption: a hypothesis that is taken for granted
atmosphere: a particular environment or surrounding influence
attack: ideas or actions intended to deal with a problem or situation
attention: the process whereby a person concentrates on some features of the environment to the (relative) exclusion of others
attitude: the arrangement of the body and its limbs
audience: an opportunity to state your case and be heard
author: someone who originates or causes or initiates something
average: lacking special distinction, rank, or status; commonly encountered
award: give, especially as an honor or reward
baby: a very young child (birth to 1 year) who has not yet begun to walk or talk
back: a support that you can lean against while sitting
background: understate the importance or quality of
bad: with great intensity (`bad' is a nonstandard variant for `badly')
bag: an activity that you like or at which you are superior
bake: be very hot, due to hot weather or exposure to the sun
balance: a wheel that regulates the rate of movement in a machine; especially a wheel oscillating against the hairspring of a timepiece to regulate its beat
ball: a lavish dance requiring formal attire
band: an unofficial association of people or groups
bank: a financial institution that accepts deposits and channels the money into lending activities
bar: a portable .30 caliber automatic rifle operated by gas pressure and fed by cartridges from a magazine; used by United States troops in World War I and in World War II and in the Korean War
base: a terrorist network intensely opposed to the United States that dispenses money and logistical support and training to a wide variety of radical Islamic terrorist groups; has cells in more than 50 countries
baseball: a ball game played with a bat and ball between two teams of nine players; teams take turns at bat trying to score runs
basis: the most important or necessary part of something
basket: horizontal circular metal hoop supporting a net through which players try to throw the basketball
bat: (baseball) a turn trying to get a hit
bath: an ancient Hebrew liquid measure equal to about 10 gallons
bathroom: a room or building equipped with one or more toilets
battle: an energetic attempt to achieve something
beach: an area of sand sloping down to the water of a sea or lake
bear: put up with something or somebody unpleasant
beat: a regular route for a sentry or policeman
beautiful: delighting the senses or exciting intellectual or emotional admiration
bed: a depression forming the ground under a body of water
bedroom: a room used primarily for sleeping
beer: a general name for alcoholic beverages made by fermenting a cereal (or mixture of cereals) flavored with hops
being: the state or fact of existing
bend: turn from a straight course, fixed direction, or line of interest
bet: the money risked on a gamble
bid: (bridge) the number of tricks a bridge player is willing to contract to make
bill: a statute in draft before it becomes law
birthday: the date on which a person was born
bite: a painful wound caused by the thrust of an insect's stinger into skin
bitter: the taste experience when quinine or coffee is taken into the mouth
blame: an accusation that you are responsible for some lapse or misdeed
blank: a blank gap or missing part
blind: something intended to misrepresent the true nature of an activity
block: an obstruction in a pipe or tube
blood: a dissolute man in fashionable society
blow: make a mess of, destroy or ruin
blue: of the color intermediate between green and violet; having a color similar to that of a clear unclouded sky
board: get on board of (trains, buses, ships, aircraft, etc.)
boat: a dish (often boat-shaped) for serving gravy or sauce
body: the property of holding together and retaining its shape
bonus: an additional payment (or other remuneration) to employees as a means of increasing output
book: physical objects consisting of a number of pages bound together
boot: the act of delivering a blow with the foot
border: form the boundary of; be contiguous to
bother: something or someone that causes trouble; a source of unhappiness
bottle: the quantity contained in a bottle
bottom: low-lying alluvial land near a river
bowl: a small round container that is open at the top for holding tobacco
box: private area in a theater or grandstand where a small group can watch the performance
boyfriend: a man who is the lover of a man or woman
brain: that which is responsible for one's thoughts, feelings, and conscious brain functions; the seat of the faculty of reason
branch: a part of a forked or branching shape
brave: possessing or displaying courage; able to face and deal with danger or fear without flinching
break: (tennis) a score consisting of winning a game when your opponent was serving
breast: the front of the trunk from the neck to the abdomen
brick: a good fellow; helpful and trustworthy
bridge: the link between two lenses; rests on the nose
brief: a document stating the facts and points of law of a client's case
brother: a close friend who accompanies his buddies in their activities
brush: the act of brushing your teeth
buddy: a close friend who accompanies his buddies in their activities
budget: a summary of intended expenditures along with proposals for how to meet them
bug: tap a telephone or telegraph wire to get information
building: the commercial activity involved in repairing old structures or constructing new ones
burn: pain that feels hot as if it were on fire
bus: a car that is old and unreliable
business: a commercial or industrial enterprise and the people who constitute it
button: a device that when pressed will release part of a mechanism
buy: make illegal payments to in exchange for favors or influence
cabinet: a storage compartment for clothes and valuables; usually it has a lock
cable: television that is transmitted over cable directly to the receiver
cake: small flat mass of chopped food
calendar: a list or register of events (appointments or social events or court cases etc)
call: assign a specified (usually proper) proper name to
camera: equipment for taking photographs (usually consisting of a lightproof box with a lens at one end and light-sensitive film at the other)
camp: an exclusive circle of people with a common purpose
campaign: several related operations aimed at achieving a particular goal (usually within geographical and temporal constraints)
can: a buoy with a round bottom and conical top
cancel: declare null and void; make ineffective
cancer: type genus of the family Cancridae
candidate: someone who is considered for something (for an office or prize or honor etc.)
candle: the basic unit of luminous intensity adopted under the Systeme International d'Unites; equal to 1/60 of the luminous intensity per square centimeter of a black body radiating at the temperature of 2,046 degrees Kelvin
candy: a rich sweet made of flavored sugar and often combined with fruit or nuts
cap: a protective covering that is part of a plant
capital: the upper part of a column that supports the entablature
car: a motor vehicle with four wheels; usually propelled by an internal combustion engine
card: a list of dishes available at a restaurant
care: prefer or wish to do something
career: the general progression of your working or professional life
carpet: floor covering consisting of a piece of thick heavy fabric (usually with nap or pile)
carry: transmit or serve as the medium for transmission
case: a specific size and style of type within a type family
cash: money in the form of bills or coins
cat: a large tracked vehicle that is propelled by two endless metal belts; frequently used for moving earth in construction and farm work
catch: reach with a blow or hit in a particular spot
category: a collection of things sharing a common attribute
cause: any entity that produces an effect or is responsible for events or results
celebration: a joyful occasion for special festivities to mark some happy event
cell: a room where a prisoner is kept
chain: British biochemist (born in Germany) who isolated and purified penicillin, which had been discovered in 1928 by Sir Alexander Fleming (1906-1979)
chair: act or preside as chair, as of an academic department in a university
champion: someone who has won first place in a competition
championship: the status of being a champion
chance: a possibility due to a favorable combination of circumstances
change: lay aside, abandon, or leave for another
channel: transmit or serve as the medium for transmission
chapter: a local branch of some fraternity or association
character: a formal recommendation by a former employer to a potential future employer describing the person's qualifications and dependability
charge: (criminal law) a pleading describing some wrong or offense
charity: a kindly and lenient attitude toward people
chart: represent by means of a graph
check: an appraisal of the state of affairs
cheek: either of the two large fleshy masses of muscular tissue that form the human rump
chemical: relating to or used in chemistry
chemistry: the science of matter; the branch of the natural sciences dealing with the composition of substances and their properties and reactions
chest: the front of the trunk from the neck to the abdomen
chicken: a domestic fowl bred for flesh or eggs; believed to have been developed from the red jungle fowl
child: a human offspring (son or daughter) of any age
childhood: the state of a child between infancy and adolescence
chocolate: a medium brown to dark-brown color
choice: the person or thing chosen or selected
church: a service conducted in a house of worship
cigarette: finely ground tobacco wrapped in paper; for smoking
city: people living in a large densely populated municipality
claim: a demand especially in the phrase
class: a body of students who graduate together
classic: of or relating to the first significant period of a civilization, culture, area of study, etc.
classroom: a room in a school where lessons take place
click: move or strike with a noise
client: someone who pays for goods or services
climate: the weather in some location averaged over some long period of time
clock: measure the time or duration of an event or action or the person who performs an action in a certain period of time
closet: a small room (or recess) or cabinet used for storage space
club: golf equipment used by a golfer to hit a golf ball
coach: teach and supervise (someone); act as a trainer or coach (to), as in sports
coast: the act of moving smoothly along a surface while remaining in contact with it
coat: put a coat on; cover the surface of; furnish with a surface
code: a set of rules or principles or laws (especially written ones)
coffee: a medium brown to dark-brown color
collection: request for a sum of money
college: a complex of buildings in which an institution of higher education is housed
combination: the act of combining things to form a new whole
combine: gather in a mass, sum, or whole
comfort: a state of being relaxed and feeling no pain
comfortable: in fortunate circumstances financially; moderately rich
command: (computer science) a line of code written as part of a computer program
comment: provide interlinear explanations for words or phrases
commercial: a commercially sponsored ad on radio or television
commission: a group of representatives or delegates
committee: a self-constituted organization to promote something
common: a piece of open land for recreational use in an urban area
communication: the activity of communicating; the activity of conveying information
community: a district where people live; occupied primarily by private residences
competition: an occasion on which a winner is selected from among two or more contestants
complaint: (criminal law) a pleading describing some wrong or offense
complex: a compound described in terms of the central atom to which other atoms are bound or coordinated
computer: a machine for performing calculations automatically
concept: an abstract or general idea inferred or derived from specific instances
concert: a performance of music by players or singers not involving theatrical staging
condition: the procedure that is varied in order to estimate a variable's effect by comparison with a control condition
conference: an association of sports teams that organizes matches for its members
conflict: go against, as of rules and laws
confusion: a feeling of embarrassment that leaves you confused
connection: the process of bringing ideas or events together in memory or imagination
consequence: a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon
consideration: kind and considerate regard for others
constant: uninterrupted in time and indefinitely long continuing
construction: the commercial activity involved in repairing old structures or constructing new ones
contact: a person who is in a position to give you special assistance
contest: an occasion on which a winner is selected from among two or more contestants
context: discourse that surrounds a language unit and helps to determine its interpretation
contribution: the effort contributed by a person in bringing about a result
conversation: the use of speech for informal exchange of views or ideas or information etc.
convert: exchange or replace with another, usually of the same kind or category
cook: tamper, with the purpose of deception
cookie: the cook on a ranch or at a camp
copy: a reproduction of a written record (e.g. of a legal or school record)
corner: an interior angle formed by two meeting walls
counter: a return punch (especially by a boxer)
country: the territory occupied by a nation
county: (United Kingdom) a region created by territorial division for the purpose of local government
courage: a quality of spirit that enables you to face danger or pain without showing fear
court: Australian woman tennis player who won many major championships (born in 1947)
cousin: the child of your aunt or uncle
cover: a recording of a song that was first recorded or made popular by somebody else
crack: a purified and potent form of cocaine that is smoked rather than snorted; highly addictive
craft: shrewdness as demonstrated by being skilled in deception
crash: the act of colliding with something
cream: toiletry consisting of any of various substances in the form of a thick liquid that have a soothing and moisturizing effect when applied to the skin
creative: having the ability or power to create
credit: a short note recognizing a source of information or of a quoted passage
criticism: disapproval expressed by pointing out faults or shortcomings
culture: a particular society at a particular time and place
cup: treat by applying evacuated cups to the patient's skin
currency: the property of belonging to the present time
current: a steady flow of a fluid (usually from natural causes)
curve: the trace of a point whose direction of motion changes
customer: someone who pays for goods or services
cut: the omission that is made when an editorial change shortens a written passage
cycle: an interval during which a recurring sequence of events occurs
dad: an informal term for a father; probably derived from baby talk
damage: the act of damaging something or someone
dance: move in a pattern; usually to musical accompaniment; do or perform a dance
dare: take upon oneself; act presumptuously, without permission
dark: the time after sunset and before sunrise while it is dark outside
data: a collection of facts from which conclusions may be drawn
database: an organized body of related information
day: the time after sunrise and before sunset while it is light outside
deal: an agreement between parties (usually arrived at after discussion) fixing obligations of each
dealer: someone who purchases and maintains an inventory of goods to be sold
dear: a sweet innocent mild-mannered person (especially a child)
death: the time at which life ends; continuing until dead
debate: a discussion in which reasons are advanced for and against some proposition or proposal
debt: an obligation to pay or do something
decision: the act of making up your mind about something
definition: a concise explanation of the meaning of a word or phrase or symbol
degree: a specific identifiable position in a continuum or series or especially in a process
delay: cause to be slowed down or delayed
delivery: recovery or preservation from loss or danger
department: a specialized division of a large organization
departure: a variation that deviates from the standard or norm
dependent: held from above and hanging down
deposit: the phenomenon of sediment or gravel accumulating
depression: a state of depression and anhedonia so severe as to require clinical intervention
depth: the extent downward or backward or inward
description: a statement that represents something in words
design: something intended as a guide for making something else

desk: a piece of furniture with a writing surface and usually drawers or other compartments
detail: a small part that can be considered separately from the whole
development: processing a photosensitive material in order to make an image visible
devil: (Judeo-Christian and Islamic religions) chief spirit of evil and adversary of God; tempter of mankind; master of Hell
diamond: the area of a baseball field that is enclosed by 3 bases and home plate
diet: the act of restricting your food intake (or your intake of particular foods)
difference: a variation that deviates from the standard or norm
dig: turn up, loosen, or remove earth
dimension: a construct whereby objects or individuals can be distinguished
dinner: a party of people assembled to have dinner together
direction: the act of setting and holding a course

disaster: a state of extreme (usually irremediable) ruin and misfortune

disease: an impairment of health or a condition of abnormal functioning
dish: an activity that you like or at which you are superior

distribution: (statistics) an arrangement of values of a variable showing their observed or theoretical frequency of occurrence
district: regulate housing in; of certain areas of towns
document: writing that provides information (especially information of an official nature)
dog: a smooth-textured sausage of minced beef or pork usually smoked; often served on a bread roll
door: the entrance (the space in a wall) through which you enter or leave a room or building; the space that a door can close
dot: scatter or intersperse like dots or studs
double: used of homologous chromosomes associated in pairs in synapsis
doubt: uncertainty about the truth or factuality or existence of something
drag: proceed for an extended period of time
drama: a dramatic work intended for performance by actors on a stage
draw: thread on or as if on a string
drawing: act of getting or draining something such as electricity or a liquid from a source
dress: cultivate, tend, and cut back the growth of
drive: hitting a golf ball off of a tee with a driver
driver: a golf club (a wood) with a near vertical face that is used for hitting long shots from the tee
drop: a shape that is spherical and small
due: capable of being assigned or credited to
dust: the remains of something that has been destroyed or broken up
duty: the social force that binds you to the courses of action demanded by that force
ear: the externally visible cartilaginous structure of the external ear
earth: the 3rd planet from the sun; the planet we live on
eat: take in food; used of animals only
economics: the branch of social science that deals with the production and distribution and consumption of goods and services and their management
economy: an act of economizing; reduction in cost
edge: the attribute of urgency in tone of voice
editor: a person responsible for the editorial aspects of publication; the person who determines the final content of a text (especially of a newspaper or magazine)
education: the United States federal department that administers all federal programs dealing with education (including federal aid to educational institutions and students); created 1979
effect: a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon
efficiency: skillfulness in avoiding wasted time and effort
effort: earnest and conscientious activity intended to do or accomplish something
egg: oval reproductive body of a fowl (especially a hen) used as food
election: a vote to select the winner of a position or political office
elevator: lifting device consisting of a platform or cage that is raised and lowered mechanically in a vertical shaft in order to move people from one floor to another in a building
emergency: a brake operated by hand; usually operates by mechanical linkage
employee: a worker who is hired to perform a job
employer: a person or firm that employs workers
employment: the occupation for which you are paid
end: a piece of cloth that is left over after the rest has been used or sold
energy: (physics) a thermodynamic quantity equivalent to the capacity of a physical system to do work; the units of energy are joules or ergs
engine: a wheeled vehicle consisting of a self-propelled engine that is used to draw trains along railway tracks
engineering: the discipline dealing with the art or science of applying scientific knowledge to practical problems
entertainment: an activity that is diverting and that holds the attention
enthusiasm: overflowing with eager enjoyment or approval
entry: a written record of a commercial transaction
environment: the area in which something exists or lives
equal: a person who is of equal standing with another in a group
equipment: an instrumentality needed for an undertaking or to perform a service
equivalent: the atomic weight of an element that has the same combining capacity as a given weight of another element; the standard is 8 for oxygen
error: a misconception resulting from incorrect information
escape: remove oneself from a familiar environment, usually for pleasure or diversion
establishment: the persons (or committees or departments etc.) who make up a body for the purpose of administering something

evening: the latter part of the day (the period of decreasing daylight from late afternoon until nightfall)
event: a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon
exam: a set of questions or exercises evaluating skill or knowledge
examination: a set of questions or exercises evaluating skill or knowledge
exchange: exchange or replace with another, usually of the same kind or category
excuse: a defense of some offensive behavior or some failure to keep a promise etc.
exit: move out of or depart from
experience: go through (mental or physical states or experiences)
expert: having or showing knowledge and skill and aptitude
explanation: a statement that makes something comprehensible by describing the relevant structure or operation or circumstances etc.
expression: a word or phrase that particular people use in particular situations
extension: the most direct or specific meaning of a word or expression; the class of objects that an expression refers to
extent: the distance or area or volume over which something extends
extreme: of the greatest possible degree or extent or intensity
fact: a concept whose truth can be proved
factor: a businessman who buys or sells for another in exchange for a commission
fail: disappoint, prove undependable to; abandon, forsake
failure: a person with a record of failing; someone who loses consistently
fall: move downward and lower, but not necessarily all the way
familiar: (usually followed by `with') well informed about or knowing thoroughly
farm: cultivate by growing, often involving improvements by means of agricultural techniques
farmer: a person who operates a farm
father: `Father' is a term of address for priests in some churches (especially the Roman Catholic Church or the Orthodox Catholic Church); `Padre' is frequently used in the military
fault: a wrong action attributable to bad judgment or ignorance or inattention
fear: regard with feelings of respect and reverence; consider hallowed or exalted or be in awe of
feature: a prominent attribute or aspect of something
fee: give a tip or gratuity to in return for a service, beyond the compensation agreed on
feedback: response to an inquiry or experiment
feel: the general atmosphere of a place or situation and the effect that it has on people
feeling: the general atmosphere of a place or situation and the effect that it has on people

few: a quantifier that can be used with count nouns and is often preceded by `a'; a small but indefinite number
fight: be engaged in a fight; carry on a fight
figure: one of the elements that collectively form a system of numeration
file: record in a public office or in a court of law
fill: make full, also in a metaphorical sense
film: make a film or photograph of something
final: not to be altered or undone
finding: the act of determining the properties of something, usually by research or calculation
finger: the length of breadth of a finger used as a linear measure
finish: a decorative texture or appearance of a surface (or the substance that gives it that appearance)
fish: (astrology) a person who is born while the sun is in Pisces

fix: a determination of the place where something is
flight: an instance of traveling by air
