flow: something that resembles a flowing stream in moving continuously
focus: become focussed or come into focus
fold: a folded part (as in skin or muscle)
following: a group of followers or enthusiasts
food: any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
football: any of various games played with a ball (round or oval) in which two teams try to kick or carry or propel the ball into each other's goal
form: the visual appearance of something or someone
formal: a lavish dance requiring formal attire
fortune: an unknown and unpredictable phenomenon that leads to a favorable outcome
foundation: education or instruction in the fundamentals of a field of knowledge
frame: a system of assumptions and standards that sanction behavior and give it meaning
freedom: immunity from an obligation or duty
friend: a member of the Religious Society of Friends founded by George Fox (the Friends have never called themselves Quakers)
friendship: the state of being friends (or friendly)
front: the side that is forward or prominent
fun: activities that are enjoyable or amusing
function: the actions and activities assigned to or required or expected of a person or group
funeral: a ceremony at which a dead person is buried or cremated
funny: an account of an amusing incident (usually with a punch line)
gain: the amount of increase in signal power or voltage or current expressed as the ratio of output to input
game: your occupation or line of work
gap: an act of delaying or interrupting the continuity
garage: a repair shop where cars and trucks are serviced and repaired
garden: a plot of ground where plants are cultivated
gas: a fossil fuel in the gaseous state; used for cooking and heating homes
gate: a computer circuit with several inputs but only one output that can be activated by particular combinations of inputs
gear: set the level or character of
gene: (genetics) a segment of DNA that is involved in producing a polypeptide chain; it can include regions preceding and following the coding DNA as well as introns between the exons; it is considered a unit of heredity
general: a general officer of the highest rank
girl: a girl or young woman with whom a man is romantically involved
girlfriend: a girl or young woman with whom a man is romantically involved
give: be the cause or source of
glad: eagerly disposed to act or to be of service
glass: a mirror; usually a ladies' dressing mirror
glove: the handwear used by fielders in playing baseball
goal: the state of affairs that a plan is intended to achieve and that (when achieved) terminates behavior intended to achieve it
god: a material effigy that is worshipped
gold: a soft yellow malleable ductile (trivalent and univalent) metallic element; occurs mainly as nuggets in rocks and alluvial deposits; does not react with most chemicals but is attacked by chlorine and aqua regia
golf: a game played on a large open course with 9 or 18 holes; the object is use as few strokes as possible in playing all the holes
good: that which is pleasing or valuable or useful
government: the act of governing; exercising authority
grab: the act of catching an object with the hands
grade: assign a rank or rating to
grand: of behavior that is impressive and ambitious in scale or scope
grandfather: the father of your father or mother
grandmother: the mother of your father or mother
grass: a police informer who implicates many people
great: in an advanced stage of pregnancy
green: an area of closely cropped grass surrounding the hole on a golf course
grocery: a marketplace where groceries are sold
ground: material in the top layer of the surface of the earth in which plants can grow (especially with reference to its quality or use)
group: a set that is closed, associative, has an identity element and every element has an inverse
growth: the gradual beginning or coming forth
guard: a device designed to prevent injury or accidents
guess: an estimate based on little or no information
guest: a visitor to whom hospitality is extended
guidance: the act of setting and holding a course
guitar: a stringed instrument usually having six strings; played by strumming or plucking
hair: a very small distance or space
half: one of two equal parts of a divisible whole
hall: United States chemist who developed an economical method of producing aluminum from bauxite (1863-1914)
hand: the (prehensile) extremity of the superior limb
handle: touch, lift, or hold with the hands
hang: fall or flow in a certain way
harm: the act of damaging something or someone
hat: headdress that protects the head from bad weather; has shaped crown and usually a brim
hate: the emotion of intense dislike; a feeling of dislike so strong that it demands action
head: (computer science) a tiny electromagnetic coil and metal pole used to write and read magnetic patterns on a disk
health: a healthy state of wellbeing free from disease
heart: the hollow muscular organ located behind the sternum and between the lungs; its rhythmic contractions move the blood through the body
heavy: slowly as if burdened by much weight
height: elevation especially above sea level or above the earth's surface
hell: (Christianity) the abode of Satan and the forces of evil; where sinners suffer eternal punishment
help: a person who contributes to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort or purpose
hide: make undecipherable or imperceptible by obscuring or concealing
highlight: move into the foreground to make more visible or prominent
highway: a major road for any form of motor transport
historian: a person who is an authority on history and who studies it and writes about it
history: a record or narrative description of past events
hit: drive something violently into a location
hold: be capable of holding or containing
hole: informal terms for a difficult situation
holiday: leisure time away from work devoted to rest or pleasure
home: (baseball) base consisting of a rubber slab where the batter stands; it must be touched by a base runner in order to score
homework: preparatory school work done outside school (especially at home)
honey: a beloved person; used as terms of endearment
hook: anything that serves as an enticement
hope: intend with some possibility of fulfilment
horse: a chessman shaped to resemble the head of a horse; can move two squares horizontally and one vertically (or vice versa)
hospital: a health facility where patients receive treatment
host: a person who acts as host at formal occasions (makes an introductory speech and introduces other speakers)
hotel: a building where travelers can pay for lodging and meals and other services
housing: structures collectively in which people are housed
human: any living or extinct member of the family Hominidae characterized by superior intelligence, articulate speech, and erect carriage
hunt: an association of huntsmen who hunt for sport
hurry: the act of moving hurriedly and in a careless manner
hurt: the act of damaging something or someone
husband: a married man; a woman's partner in marriage
idea: (music) melodic subject of a musical composition
ideal: of or relating to the philosophical doctrine of the reality of ideas
if: In case that; granting, allowing, or supposing that;  introducing a condition or supposition.
illegal: prohibited by law or by official or accepted rules
imagination: the ability to form mental images of things or events
impact: the violent interaction of individuals or groups entering into combat
implement: pursue to a conclusion or bring to a successful issue
impression: a concavity in a surface produced by pressing
improvement: a change for the better; progress in development
incident: (sometimes followed by `to') minor or casual or subordinate in significance or nature or occurring as a chance concomitant or consequence
income: the financial gain (earned or unearned) accruing over a given period of time
increase: the amount by which something increases
independence: freedom from control or influence of another or others
independent: (of a clause) capable of standing syntactically alone as a complete sentence
indication: something that serves to indicate or suggest
individual: characteristic of or meant for a single person or thing
industry: the organized action of making of goods and services for sale
inflation: a general and progressive increase in prices
influence: induce into action by using one's charm
injury: a casualty to military personnel resulting from combat
insect: a person who has a nasty or unethical character undeserving of respect
insurance: written contract or certificate of insurance
intention: an anticipated outcome that is intended or that guides your planned actions
interaction: (physics) the transfer of energy between elementary particles or between an elementary particle and a field or between fields; mediated by gauge bosons
internet: a computer network consisting of a worldwide network of computer networks that use the TCP/IP network protocols to facilitate data transmission and exchange
interview: conduct an interview in television, newspaper, and radio reporting
introduction: formally making a person known to another or to the public
investment: money that is invested with an expectation of profit
invite: ask someone in a friendly way to do something
iron: home appliance consisting of a flat metal base that is heated and used to smooth cloth
island: a land mass (smaller than a continent) that is surrounded by water
issue: a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon
it: the branch of engineering that deals with the use of computers and telecommunications to retrieve and store and transmit information
item: an individual instance of a type of symbol
jacket: (dentistry) dental appliance consisting of an artificial crown for a broken or decayed tooth
job: a specific piece of work required to be done as a duty or for a specific fee
join: be or become joined or united or linked
joint: marijuana leaves rolled into a cigarette for smoking
joke: a ludicrous or grotesque act done for fun and amusement
judge: judge tentatively or form an estimate of (quantities or time)
judgment: the act of judging or assessing a person or situation or event
juice: any of several liquids of the body
junior: used of the third or next to final year in United States high school or college
jury: a committee appointed to judge a competition
keep: the main tower within the walls of a medieval castle or fortress
key: a coral reef off the southern coast of Florida
kick: the act of delivering a blow with the foot
kid: be silly or tease one another
kill: mark for deletion, rub off, or erase
king: a male sovereign; ruler of a kingdom
kiss: the act of caressing with the lips (or an instance thereof)
kitchen: a room equipped for preparing meals
knee: joint between the femur and tibia in a quadruped; corresponds to the human knee
knife: any long thin projection that is transient
knowledge: the psychological result of perception and learning and reasoning
lab: a workplace for the conduct of scientific research
lake: a body of (usually fresh) water surrounded by land
land: material in the top layer of the surface of the earth in which plants can grow (especially with reference to its quality or use)
landscape: a genre of art dealing with the depiction of natural scenery
language: a systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds or conventional symbols
law: the learned profession that is mastered by graduate study in a law school and that is responsible for the judicial system
lawyer: a professional person authorized to practice law; conducts lawsuits or gives legal advice
lay: a narrative poem of popular origin
layer: an abstract place usually conceived as having depth
leader: a featured article of merchandise sold at a loss in order to draw customers
league: an association of sports teams that organizes matches for its members
leather: an animal skin made smooth and flexible by removing the hair and then tanning
leave: leave unchanged or undisturbed or refrain from taking
leg: a part of a forked or branching shape
lesson: punishment intended as a warning to others
let: grant use or occupation of under a term of contract
letter: the conventional characters of the alphabet used to represent speech
level: a specific identifiable position in a continuum or series or especially in a process
library: a depository built to contain books and other materials for reading and study
life: the experience of being alive; the course of human events and activities
lift: lifting device consisting of a platform or cage that is raised and lowered mechanically in a vertical shaft in order to move people from one floor to another in a building
light: the quality of being luminous; emitting or reflecting light
limit: the mathematical value toward which a function goes as the independent variable approaches infinity
line: a course of reasoning aimed at demonstrating a truth or falsehood; the methodical process of logical reasoning
link: a two-way radio communication system (usually microwave); part of a more extensive telecommunication network
lip: the top edge of a vessel or other container
list: give or make a list of; name individually; give the names of
listen: pay close attention to; give heed to
literature: the humanistic study of a body of literature
living: the experience of being alive; the course of human events and activities
load: a quantity that can be processed or transported at one time
loan: a word borrowed from another language; e.g. `blitz' is a German word borrowed into modern English
local: anesthetic that numbs a particular area of the body
location: a determination of the place where something is
lock: a restraint incorporated into the ignition switch to prevent the use of a vehicle by persons who do not have the key
log: cut lumber, as in woods and forests
look: take charge of or deal with
loss: the amount by which the cost of a business exceeds its revenue
love: sexual activities (often including sexual intercourse) between two people
luck: an unknown and unpredictable phenomenon that leads to a favorable outcome
machine: a motor vehicle with four wheels; usually propelled by an internal combustion engine
magazine: a business firm that publishes magazines
mail: cause to be directed or transmitted to another place
main: (of a clause) capable of standing syntactically alone as a complete sentence
maintenance: the unauthorized interference in a legal action by a person having no interest in it (as by helping one party with money or otherwise to continue the action) so as to obstruct justice or promote unnecessary litigation or unsettle the peace of the community
major: British statesman who was prime minister from 1990 until 1997 (born in 1943)
mall: mercantile establishment consisting of a carefully landscaped complex of shops representing leading merchandisers; usually includes restaurants and a convenient parking area; a modern version of the traditional marketplace
man: someone who serves in the armed forces; a member of a military force
manager: (sports) someone in charge of training an athlete or a team
manner: a way of acting or behaving
many: a quantifier that can be used with count nouns and is often preceded by `as' or `too' or `so' or `that'; amounting to a large but indefinite number
map: (mathematics) a mathematical relation such that each element of a given set (the domain of the function) is associated with an element of another set (the range of the function)
march: lie adjacent to another or share a boundary
mark: celebrate by some ceremony or observation
market: an area in a town where a public mercantile establishment is set up
marketing: the exchange of goods for an agreed sum of money
marriage: two people who are married to each other
master: a combatant who is able to defeat rivals
match: a person who is of equal standing with another in a group
mate: the officer below the master on a commercial ship
material: artifact made by weaving or felting or knitting or crocheting natural or synthetic fibers
math: a science (or group of related sciences) dealing with the logic of quantity and shape and arrangement
meal: the food served and eaten at one time
measurement: the act or process of assigning numbers to phenomena according to a rule
meat: the choicest or most essential or most vital part of some idea or experience
medium: (usually plural) transmissions that are disseminated widely to the public
meet: contend against an opponent in a sport, game, or battle
meeting: the social act of assembling for some common purpose
member: the male sex organ (`member' is a euphemism)
membership: the body of members of an organization or group
memory: the power of retaining and recalling past experience
mention: a short note recognizing a source of information or of a quoted passage
menu: a list of dishes available at a restaurant
mess: informal terms for a difficult situation
message: what a communication that is about something is about
metal: containing or made of or resembling or characteristic of a metal
method: an acting technique introduced by Stanislavsky in which the actor recalls emotions or reactions from his or her own life and uses them to identify with the character being portrayed
midnight: 12 o'clock at night; the middle of the night
milk: a river that rises in the Rockies in northwestern Montana and flows eastward to become a tributary of the Missouri River
mind: pay close attention to; give heed to
mine: excavation in the earth from which ores and minerals are extracted
miss: fail to perceive or to catch with the senses or the mind
mission: a group of representatives or delegates
mistake: a wrong action attributable to bad judgment or ignorance or inattention
mix: open (a place) to members of all races and ethnic groups
mixture: a collection containing a variety of sorts of things
mode: any of various fixed orders of the various diatonic notes within an octave
model: a person who poses for a photographer or painter or sculptor
money: the most common medium of exchange; functions as legal tender
monitor: display produced by a device that takes signals and displays them on a television screen or a computer monitor
month: one of the twelve divisions of the calendar year
morning: the time period between dawn and noon
mortgage: a conditional conveyance of property as security for the repayment of a loan
most: (of actions or states) slightly short of or not quite accomplished; all but
motor: conveying information to the muscles from the CNS
mountain: a land mass that projects well above its surroundings; higher than a hill
movie: a form of entertainment that enacts a story by sound and a sequence of images giving the illusion of continuous movement
mud: soil with mud, muck, or mire
name: assign a specified (usually proper) proper name to
nation: a politically organized body of people under a single government
national: a person who owes allegiance to that nation
native: characteristic of or relating to people inhabiting a region from the beginning
natural: (of a parent or child) related by blood; genetically related
nature: a causal agent creating and controlling things in the universe
neat: free from clumsiness; precisely or deftly executed
neck: kiss, embrace, or fondle with sexual passion
negative: designed or tending to discredit, especially without positive or helpful suggestions
negotiation: a discussion intended to produce an agreement
nerve: any bundle of nerve fibers running to various organs and tissues of the body
net: the excess of revenues over outlays in a given period of time (including depreciation and other non-cash expenses)
network: an open fabric of string or rope or wire woven together at regular intervals
news: information about recent and important events
newspaper: the physical object that is the product of a newspaper publisher
night: the time after sunset and before sunrise while it is dark outside
noise: the auditory experience of sound that lacks musical quality; sound that is a disagreeable auditory experience
normal: something regarded as a normative example
north: British statesman under George III whose policies led to rebellion in the American colonies (1732-1792)
nose: catch the scent of; get wind of
note: a piece of paper money (especially one issued by a central bank)
notice: make or write a comment on
novel: original and of a kind not seen before
nurse: a woman who is the custodian of children
object: the goal intended to be attained (and which is believed to be attainable)
objective: serving as or indicating the object of a verb or of certain prepositions and used for certain other purposes
obligation: a personal relation in which one is indebted for a service or favor
occasion: an event that occurs at a critical time
officer: any person in the armed services who holds a position of authority or command
official: conforming to set usage, procedure, or discipline
oil: oil paint containing pigment that is used by an artist
one: (informal) very; used informally as an intensifier
opening: an open or empty space in or between things
operation: activity by a military or naval force (as a maneuver or campaign)
opinion: the reason for a court's judgment (as opposed to the decision itself)
opportunity: a possibility due to a favorable combination of circumstances
option: the act of choosing or selecting
orange: of the color between red and yellow; similar to the color of a ripe orange
order: (usually plural) the status or rank or office of a Christian clergyman in an ecclesiastical hierarchy
ordinary: lacking special distinction, rank, or status; commonly encountered
organization: the persons (or committees or departments etc.) who make up a body for the purpose of administering something
original: something that serves as a model or a basis for making copies
outcome: a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon
oven: kitchen appliance used for baking or roasting
pace: a unit of length equal to 3 feet; defined as 91.44 centimeters; originally taken to be the average length of a stride
page: United States diplomat and writer about the Old South (1853-1922)
pain: cause emotional anguish or make miserable
paint: a substance used as a coating to protect or decorate a surface (especially a mixture of pigment suspended in a liquid); dries to form a hard coating
painting: graphic art consisting of an artistic composition made by applying paints to a surface
pair: a set of two similar things considered as a unit
panic: sudden mass fear and anxiety over anticipated events
paper: the physical object that is the product of a newspaper publisher
parent: look after a child until it is an adult
park: a large area of land preserved in its natural state as public property
parking: space in which vehicles can be parked
part: the effort contributed by a person in bringing about a result
party: an organization to gain political power
passage: the passing of a law by a legislative body
passenger: a traveler riding in a vehicle (a boat or bus or car or plane or train etc) who is not operating it
passion: any object of warm affection or devotion
past: a verb tense that expresses actions or states in the past
path: an established line of travel or access
patience: good-natured tolerance of delay or incompetence
patient: the semantic role of an entity that is not the agent but is directly involved in or affected by the happening denoted by the verb in the clause
pattern: a customary way of operation or behavior
pause: interrupt temporarily an activity before continuing
peace: the absence of mental stress or anxiety
pen: a correctional institution for those convicted of major crimes
percentage: a proportion in relation to a whole (which is usually the amount per hundred)
perception: becoming aware of something via the senses
permission: the act of giving a formal (usually written) authorization
permit: make it possible through a specific action or lack of action for something to happen
personal: a short newspaper article about a particular person or group
perspective: the appearance of things relative to one another as determined by their distance from the viewer
phase: a particular point in the time of a cycle; measured from some arbitrary zero and expressed as an angle
philosophy: a belief (or system of beliefs) accepted as authoritative by some group or school
phone: (phonetics) an individual sound unit of speech without concern as to whether or not it is a phoneme of some language
photo: a representation of a person or scene in the form of a print or transparent slide or in digital format
phrase: an expression whose meanings cannot be inferred from the meanings of the words that make it up
physical: impelled by physical force especially against resistance
physics: the science of matter and energy and their interactions
pick: the quantity of a crop that is harvested
picture: graphic art consisting of an artistic composition made by applying paints to a surface
pie: a prehistoric unrecorded language that was the ancestor of all Indo-European languages
pin: a holder attached to the gunwale of a boat that holds the oar in place and acts as a fulcrum for rowing
pitch: set the level or character of
pizza: Italian open pie made of thin bread dough spread with a spiced mixture of e.g. tomato sauce and cheese
plane: a power tool for smoothing or shaping wood
plant: (botany) a living organism lacking the power of locomotion
plastic: capable of being molded or modeled (especially of earth or clay or other soft material)
plate: (baseball) base consisting of a rubber slab where the batter stands; it must be touched by a base runner in order to score
platform: a woman's shoe with a very high thick sole
play: contend against an opponent in a sport, game, or battle
player: someone who takes part in an activity
pleasure: a fundamental feeling that is hard to define but that people desire to experience
poem: a composition written in metrical feet forming rhythmical lines
poet: a writer of poems (the term is usually reserved for writers of good poetry)
police: the force of policemen and officers
policy: written contract or certificate of insurance
politics: social relations involving intrigue to gain authority or power
pollution: the act of contaminating or polluting; including (either intentionally or accidentally) unwanted substances or factors
pool: something resembling a pool of liquid
population: (statistics) the entire aggregation of items from which samples can be drawn
position: a condition or position in which you find yourself
possession: the trait of resolutely controlling your own behavior
possibility: a tentative insight into the natural world; a concept that is not yet verified but that if true would explain certain facts or phenomena
potato: annual native to South America having underground stolons bearing edible starchy tubers; widely cultivated as a garden vegetable; vines are poisonous
potential: the difference in electrical charge between two points in a circuit expressed in volts
power: energy made available by the flow of electric charge through a conductor
preparation: the cognitive process of thinking about what you will do in the event of something happening
presence: the immediate proximity of someone or something
present: perform (a play), especially on a stage
presentation: formally making a person known to another or to the public
president: the officer who presides at the meetings of an organization
pressure: to cause to do through pressure or necessity, by physical, moral or intellectual means
price: value measured by what must be given or done or undergone to obtain something
pride: a feeling of self-respect and personal worth
priest: a person who performs religious duties and ceremonies in a non-Christian religion
primary: a preliminary election where delegates or nominees are chosen
principle: (law) an explanation of the fundamental reasons (especially an explanation of the working of some device in terms of laws of nature)
priority: status established in order of importance or urgency
procedure: a process or series of acts especially of a practical or mechanical nature involved in a particular form of work
process: a natural prolongation or projection from a part of an organism either animal or plant
produce: come to have or undergo a change of (physical features and attributes)
product: the set of elements common to two or more sets
profession: an open avowal (true or false) of some belief or opinion
professional: a person engaged in one of the learned professions
professor: someone who is a member of the faculty at a college or university
profile: degree of exposure to public notice
profit: the excess of revenues over outlays in a given period of time (including depreciation and other non-cash expenses)
program: an integrated course of academic studies
progress: move forward, also in the metaphorical sense
project: any piece of work that is undertaken or attempted
promise: make a prediction about; tell in advance
promotion: a message issued in behalf of some product or cause or idea or person or institution
proof: the act of validating; finding or testing the truth of something
property: a construct whereby objects or individuals can be distinguished
protection: payment extorted by gangsters on threat of violence
public: people in general considered as a whole
punch: a tool for making holes or indentations
purchase: the mechanical advantage gained by being in a position to use a lever
push: press, drive, or impel (someone) to action or completion of an action
quality: (music) the distinctive property of a complex sound (a voice or noise or musical sound)
quantity: how much there is or how many there are of something that you can quantify
quarter: pull (a person) apart with four horses tied to his extremities, so as to execute him
question: uncertainty about the truth or factuality or existence of something
quiet: (of a body of water) free from disturbance by heavy waves
quit: put an end to a state or an activity
quote: refer to for illustration or proof
radio: an electronic receiver that detects and demodulates and amplifies transmitted signals
rain: anything happening rapidly or in quick successive
range: assign a rank or rating to
rate: assign a rank or rating to
ratio: the relation between things (or parts of things) with respect to their comparative quantity, magnitude, or degree
reach: move forward or upward in order to touch; also in a metaphorical sense
reaction: (chemistry) a process in which one or more substances are changed into others
read: have or contain a certain wording or form
reading: written material intended to be read
reality: all of your experiences that determine how things appear to you
recommendation: any quality or characteristic that gains a person a favorable reception or acceptance or admission
recording: the act of making a record (especially an audio record)
recover: get or find back; recover the use of
red: the amount by which the cost of a business exceeds its revenue
reference: a formal recommendation by a former employer to a potential future employer describing the person's qualifications and dependability
reflection: a likeness in which left and right are reversed
refrigerator: white goods in which food can be stored at low temperatures
region: a part of an animal that has a special function or is supplied by a given artery or nerve
register: an official written record of names or events or transactions
regret: sadness associated with some wrong done or some disappointment
relation: (law) the principle that an act done at a later time is deemed by law to have occurred at an earlier time
relationship: (anthropology) relatedness or connection by blood or marriage or adoption
relative: an animal or plant that bears a relationship to another (as related by common descent or by membership in the same genus)
release: part with a possession or right
relief: the feeling that comes when something burdensome is removed or reduced
remote: far apart in relevance or relationship or kinship
remove: remove something concrete, as by lifting, pushing, or taking off, or remove something abstract
rent: grant use or occupation of under a term of contract
repair: restore by replacing a part or putting together what is torn or broken
repeat: to say, state, or perform again
replacement: a person who follows next in order
report: an essay (especially one written as an assignment)
representative: an item of information that is typical of a class or group
republic: a political system in which the supreme power lies in a body of citizens who can elect people to represent them
reputation: the state of being held in high esteem and honor
request: express the need or desire for
reserve: give or assign a resource to a particular person or cause
resident: used of animals that do not migrate
resist: stand up or offer resistance to somebody or something
resource: the ability to deal resourcefully with unusual problems
respect: (usually preceded by `in') a detail or point
response: the speech act of continuing a conversational exchange
responsibility: a form of trustworthiness; the trait of being answerable to someone for something or being responsible for one's conduct
restaurant: a building where people go to eat
result: a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon
return: the income or profit arising from such transactions as the sale of land or other property
review: a variety show with topical sketches and songs and dancing and comedians
revolution: a single complete turn (axial or orbital)
rice: English lyricist who frequently worked with Andrew Lloyd Webber (born in 1944)
rich: marked by richness and fullness of flavor
ride: a journey in a vehicle (usually an automobile)
ring: the sound of a bell ringing
rip: a dissolute man in fashionable society
rise: get up and out of bed
risk: the probability of becoming infected given that exposure to an infectious agent has occurred
river: a large natural stream of water (larger than a creek)
road: an open way (generally public) for travel or transportation
rock: move back and forth or sideways
role: the actions and activities assigned to or required or expected of a person or group
roof: an upper limit on what is allowed
round: a regular route for a sentry or policeman
routine: a short performance that is part of a longer program
royal: belonging to or befitting a supreme ruler
rule: (linguistics) a rule describing (or prescribing) a linguistic practice
safe: contraceptive device consisting of a sheath of thin rubber or latex that is worn over the penis during intercourse
safety: a device designed to prevent injury or accidents
sail: move with sweeping, effortless, gliding motions
salad: food mixtures either arranged on a plate or tossed and served with a moist dressing; usually consisting of or including greens
sale: an agreement (or contract) in which property is transferred from the seller (vendor) to the buyer (vendee) for a fixed price in money (paid or agreed to be paid by the buyer)
salt: the taste experience when common salt is taken into the mouth
sand: French writer known for works concerning women's rights and independence (1804-1876)
sandwich: insert or squeeze tightly between two people or objects
satisfaction: state of being gratified or satisfied
save: make unnecessary an expenditure or effort
savings: a fund of money put by as a reserve
scale: a thin flake of dead epidermis shed from the surface of the skin
scene: the context and environment in which something is set
schedule: a temporally organized plan for matters to be attended to
scheme: form intrigues (for) in an underhand manner
science: ability to produce solutions in some problem domain
score: a written form of a musical composition; parts for different instruments appear on separate staves on large pages
scratch: a line indicating the location of the start of a race or a game
screen: protect, hide, or conceal from danger or harm
sea: anything apparently limitless in quantity or volume
season: one of the natural periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices or atmospheric conditions
seat: show to a seat; assign a seat for
secretary: a person to whom a secret is entrusted
section: a self-contained part of a larger composition (written or musical)
sector: a particular aspect of life or activity
security: defense against financial failure; financial independence
selection: the person or thing chosen or selected
self: your consciousness of your own identity
sell: deliver to an enemy by treachery
senior: a person who is older than you are
sense: the meaning of a word or expression; the way in which a word or expression or situation can be interpreted
sentence: pronounce a sentence on (somebody) in a court of law
series: a periodical that appears at scheduled times
set: an unofficial association of people or groups
setting: the context and environment in which something is set
sex: the properties that distinguish organisms on the basis of their reproductive roles
shake: move back and forth or sideways
shape: the visual appearance of something or someone
share: the effort contributed by a person in bringing about a result
she: This or that female; the woman understood or referred to; the animal of the female sex, or object personified as feminine, which was spoken of.
shelter: a way of organizing business to reduce the taxes it must pay on current earnings
shift: lay aside, abandon, or leave for another
shine: be bright by reflecting or casting light
shirt: a garment worn on the upper half of the body
shock: the violent interaction of individuals or groups entering into combat
shoe: a restraint provided when the brake linings are moved hydraulically against the brake drum to retard the wheel's rotation
shoot: make a film or photograph of something
shop: small workplace where handcrafts or manufacturing are done
shopping: searching for or buying goods or services
shot: an estimate based on little or no information
shoulder: a narrow edge of land (usually unpaved) along the side of a road
shower: someone who organizes an exhibit for others to see
sick: affected by an impairment of normal physical or mental function
side: an opinion that is held in opposition to another in an argument or dispute
sign: structure displaying a board on which advertisements can be posted
signal: be a signal for or a symptom of
significance: a meaning that is not expressly stated but can be inferred
simple: apart from anything else; without additions or modifications
sing: make a whining, ringing, or whistling sound
singer: United States inventor of an improved chain-stitch sewing machine (1811-1875)
single: characteristic of or meant for a single person or thing
sink: fall heavily or suddenly; decline markedly
sir: a title used before the name of knight or baronet
sister: a female person who has the same parents as another person
situation: a condition or position in which you find yourself
skill: an ability that has been acquired by training
skin: a member of any of several British or American groups consisting predominantly of young people who shave their heads; some engage in white supremacist and anti-immigrant activities and this leads to the perception that all skinheads are racist and violent
skirt: avoid or try to avoid fulfilling, answering, or performing (duties, questions, or issues)
sky: throw or toss with a light motion
sleep: a period of time spent sleeping
slide: move obliquely or sideways, usually in an uncontrolled manner
slip: move obliquely or sideways, usually in an uncontrolled manner
smell: any property detected by the olfactory system
smile: a facial expression characterized by turning up the corners of the mouth; usually shows pleasure or amusement
smoke: a hot vapor containing fine particles of carbon being produced by combustion
snow: English writer of novels about moral dilemmas in academe (1905-1980)
society: the state of being with someone
software: (computer science) written programs or procedures or rules and associated documentation pertaining to the operation of a computer system and that are stored in read/write memory
soil: material in the top layer of the surface of the earth in which plants can grow (especially with reference to its quality or use)
solid: the state in which a substance has no tendency to flow under moderate stress; resists forces (such as compression) that tend to deform it; and retains a definite size and shape
solution: a statement that solves a problem or explains how to solve the problem
somewhere: in or at or to some place
son: the divine word of God; the second person in the Trinity (incarnate in Jesus)
sort: an operation that segregates items into groups according to a specified criterion
sound: (phonetics) an individual sound unit of speech without concern as to whether or not it is a phoneme of some language
source: a publication (or a passage from a publication) that is referred to
south: the cardinal compass point that is at 180 degrees
space: (printing) a block of type without a raised letter; used for spacing between words or sentences
spare: not taken up by scheduled activities
speaker: electro-acoustic transducer that converts electrical signals into sounds loud enough to be heard at a distance
specific: a fact about some part (as opposed to general)
speed: a rate (usually rapid) at which something happens
spirit: the general atmosphere of a place or situation and the effect that it has on people
spiritual: a kind of religious song originated by Blacks in the southern United States
spite: malevolence by virtue of being malicious or spiteful or nasty
split: having been divided; having the unity destroyed
spray: a dispenser that turns a liquid (such as perfume) into a fine mist
spring: the elasticity of something that can be stretched and returns to its original length
staff: (music) the system of five horizontal lines on which the musical notes are written
stage: plan, organize, and carry out (an event)
stand: put up with something or somebody unpleasant
standard: a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated
state: indicate through a symbol, formula, etc.
statement: (computer science) a line of code written as part of a computer program
status: a state at a particular time
stay: hang on during a trial of endurance
steak: a slice of meat cut from the fleshy part of an animal or large fish
stick: marijuana leaves rolled into a cigarette for smoking
still: to a greater degree or extent; used with comparisons
stock: the handle of a handgun or the butt end of a rifle or shotgun or part of the support of a machine gun or artillery gun
stomach: the region of the body of a vertebrate between the thorax and the pelvis
stop: put an end to a state or an activity
storm: behave violently, as if in state of a great anger
story: a record or narrative description of past events
stranger: anyone who does not belong in the environment in which they are found
strategy: an elaborate and systematic plan of action
strength: capability in terms of personnel and materiel that affect the capacity to fight a war
stress: to stress, single out as important
stretch: exercise designed to extend the limbs and muscles to their full extent
strike: drive something violently into a location
string: thread on or as if on a string
stroke: a light touch with the hands
structure: the people in a society considered as a system organized by a characteristic pattern of relationships
struggle: climb awkwardly, as if by scrambling
student: a learner who is enrolled in an educational institution
studio: an apartment with a living space and a bathroom and a small kitchen
subject: a branch of knowledge
substance: the property of holding together and retaining its shape
success: a person with a record of successes
sugar: an essential structural component of living cells and source of energy for animals; includes simple sugars with small molecules as well as macromolecular substances; are classified according to the number of monosaccharide groups they contain
suggestion: a proposal offered for acceptance or rejection
summer: the warmest season of the year; in the northern hemisphere it extends from the summer solstice to the autumnal equinox
sun: first day of the week; observed as a day of rest and worship by most Christians
supermarket: a large self-service grocery store selling groceries and dairy products and household goods
support: financial resources provided to make some project possible
surgery: a room in a hospital equipped for the performance of surgical operations
suspect: imagine to be the case or true or probable
sweet: not containing or composed of salt water
swing: in baseball; a batter's attempt to hit a pitched ball
switch: lay aside, abandon, or leave for another
sympathy: sharing the feelings of others (especially feelings of sorrow or anguish)
system: an ordered manner; orderliness by virtue of being methodical and well organized
tank: a large (usually metallic) vessel for holding gases or liquids
tap: draw from; make good use of
target: the location of the target that is to be hit
task: a specific piece of work required to be done as a duty or for a specific fee
tax: set or determine the amount of (a payment such as a fine)
tea: a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree extensively cultivated in e.g. China and Japan and India; source of tea leaves
teacher: a person whose occupation is teaching
tear: a drop of the clear salty saline solution secreted by the lacrimal glands
technology: the discipline dealing with the art or science of applying scientific knowledge to practical problems
telephone: electronic equipment that converts sound into electrical signals that can be transmitted over distances and then converts received signals back into sounds
television: broadcasting visual images of stationary or moving objects
tell: give instructions to or direct somebody to do something with authority
temperature: the degree of hotness or coldness of a body or environment (corresponding to its molecular activity)
temporary: a worker (especially in an office) hired on a temporary basis
tennis: a game played with rackets by two or four players who hit a ball back and forth over a net that divides the court
tension: the physical condition of being stretched or strained
term: the end of gestation or point at which birth is imminent
test: trying something to find out about it
text: a book prepared for use in schools or colleges
theme: (music) melodic subject of a musical composition
theory: a tentative insight into the natural world; a concept that is not yet verified but that if true would explain certain facts or phenomena
thought: a personal belief or judgment that is not founded on proof or certainty
throat: the passage to the stomach and lungs; in the front part of the neck below the chin and above the collarbone
ticket: a label written or printed on paper, cardboard, or plastic that is attached to something to indicate its owner, nature, price, etc.
time: a reading of a point in time as given by a clock
title: a heading that names a statute or legislative bill; may give a brief summary of the matters it deals with
tone: a quality of a given color that differs slightly from another color
tongue: a narrow strip of land that juts out into the sea
tonight: during the night of the present day
tool: ride in a car with no particular goal and just for the pleasure of it
topic: the subject matter of a conversation or discussion
tough: making great mental demands; hard to comprehend or solve or believe
tour: a period of time spent in military service
towel: a rectangular piece of absorbent cloth (or paper) for drying or wiping
tower: appear very large or occupy a commanding position
town: an administrative division of a county
track: any road or path affording passage especially a rough one
tradition: a specific practice of long standing
traffic: social or verbal interchange (usually followed by `with')
train: teach and supervise (someone); act as a trainer or coach (to), as in sports
trainer: simulator consisting of a machine on the ground that simulates the conditions of flying a plane
transition: an event that results in a transformation
transportation: the act of expelling a person from their native land
trash: worthless material that is to be disposed of
travel: change location; move, travel, or proceed, also metaphorically
treat: provide with choice or abundant food or drink
trick: an illusory feat; considered magical by naive observers
truck: an automotive vehicle suitable for hauling
trust: complete confidence in a person or plan etc
truth: the quality of being near to the true value
try: melt (fat or lard) in order to separate out impurities
turn: to break and turn over earth especially with a plow
twist: twist suddenly so as to sprain
type: a person of a specified kind (usually with many eccentricities)
uncle: a source of help and advice and encouragement
understanding: the statement (oral or written) of an exchange of promises
union: healing process involving the growing together of the edges of a wound or the growing together of broken bones
unit: an organization regarded as part of a larger social group
university: a large and diverse institution of higher learning created to educate for life and for a profession and to grant degrees
upper: a central nervous system stimulant that increases energy and decreases appetite; used to treat narcolepsy and some forms of depression
use: exerting shrewd or devious influence especially for one's own advantage
user: a person who uses something or someone selfishly or unethically
vacation: leisure time away from work devoted to rest or pleasure
valuable: having worth or merit or value
variation: an activity that varies from a norm or standard
variety: a collection containing a variety of sorts of things
vast: unusually great in size or amount or degree or especially extent or scope
vegetable: edible seeds or roots or stems or leaves or bulbs or tubers or nonsweet fruits of any of numerous herbaceous plant
vehicle: any inanimate object (as a towel or money or clothing or dishes or books or toys etc.) that can transmit infectious agents from one person to another
version: a written communication in a second language having the same meaning as the written communication in a first language
video: broadcasting visual images of stationary or moving objects
view: the act of looking or seeing or observing
village: a mainly residential district of Manhattan; `the Village' became a home for many writers and artists in the 20th century
virus: a software program capable of reproducing itself and usually capable of causing great harm to files or other programs on the same computer
visit: come to see in an official or professional capacity
voice: the sound made by the vibration of vocal folds modified by the resonance of the vocal tract
volume: physical objects consisting of a number of pages bound together
wait: the act of waiting (remaining inactive in one place while expecting something)
wake: the consequences of an event (especially a catastrophic event)
walk: the act of traveling by foot
wall: an embankment built around a space for defensive purposes
war: the waging of armed conflict against an enemy
warning: cautionary advice about something imminent (especially imminent danger or other unpleasantness)
wash: the erosive process of washing away soil or gravel by water (as from a roadway)
watch: a person employed to keep watch for some anticipated event
water: the part of the earth's surface covered with water (such as a river or lake or ocean)
wave: signal with the hands or nod
wealth: the state of being rich and affluent; having a plentiful supply of material goods and money
wear: exhaust or get tired through overuse or great strain or stress
web: computer network consisting of a collection of internet sites that offer text and graphics and sound and animation resources through the hypertext transfer protocol
wedding: the social event at which the ceremony of marriage is performed
week: hours or days of work in a calendar week
weekend: a time period usually extending from Friday night through Sunday; more loosely defined as any period of successive days including one and only one Sunday
weight: a system of units used to express the weight of something
weird: suggesting the operation of supernatural influences
welcome: bid welcome to; greet upon arrival
wheel: move along on or as if on wheels or a wheeled vehicle
while: a period of indeterminate length (usually short) marked by some action or condition
wife: a married woman; a man's partner in marriage
will: a legal document declaring a person's wishes regarding the disposal of their property when they die
win: attain success or reach a desired goal
wind: raise or haul up with or as if with mechanical help
window: a pane of glass in a window
wine: a red as dark as red wine
wing: travel through the air; be airborne
winner: a person with a record of successes
wish: prefer or wish to do something
witness: (law) a person who attests to the genuineness of a document or signature by adding their own signature
woman: a human female employed to do housework
wonder: something that causes feelings of wonder
wood: United States painter noted for works based on life in the Midwest (1892-1942)
word: the divine word of God; the second person in the Trinity (incarnate in Jesus)
worker: a member of the working class (not necessarily employed)
world: people in general; especially a distinctive group of people with some shared interest
worth: French couturier (born in England) regarded as the founder of Parisian haute couture; noted for introducing the bustle (1825-1895)
wrap: arrange or fold as a cover or protection
writer: writes (books or stories or articles or the like) professionally (for pay)
writing: the work of a writer; anything expressed in letters of the alphabet (especially when considered from the point of view of style and effect)
yard: a unit of volume (as for sand or gravel)
year: a body of students who graduate together
yellow: of the color intermediate between green and orange in the color spectrum; of something resembling the color of an egg yolk
you: The pronoun of the second person, in the nominative, dative, and objective case, indicating the person or persons addressed.
young: (of crops) harvested at an early stage of development; before complete maturity
zone: regulate housing in; of certain areas of towns
